entry.title: Danger Nights
entry.summary:
Author: lanoirpapillon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,403Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: A cup being placed beside his hand startled him, and he glanced up at the pepper-haired man with a badge touting the fact that he was part of the police. Derek stiffened, his hand curling around his own mug to keep himself from showing any outward signs of distress. What the fuck did Jackson do?“You’re Derek Hale, right?” Derek inclined his head in response, and he resisted the urge to bare his teeth as the policeman took a seat across from him. The man held up his hands, a smirk playing across his lips as he took a sip from his own to-go cup.“Just checking to see how Jackson is doing; I heard he wasn’t feeling well. And to pass on a message,” He dug around in his coat, withdrawing an envelope with a wax seal.“Jackson is doing fine…a message?” Derek flexed his fingers, wanting to grab the note and tear into it, to figure out why the government was getting in contact with him, the seal boasting the Royal Coat of Arms making his stomach drop.“Yes, it is to my understanding that your petition for permanent residence in the city has been accepted, congratulations.”---AKA the one where Jackson, Derek, and Stiles are (not so) accidentally absorbed into John Watson's pack.

entry.title: All Around Me I Heard You Pass
entry.summary:
Author: sockpuppetstrings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,083Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 38

Summary: Beyond the Boundary lies the Great Forest, where the gods of Beacon Hills reside. Derek—the dark mark on the Hale house—is the small time deity Stiles’ mother has chosen as her patron. But on the dreadful day of her death, the Nemeton is severed—a burgeoning god meant to join the Hale Pantheon. Someone local is to blame and Peter retaliates by descending on the village with a terrible decree: the town must sacrifice one of its own for the next eight years. It's a mysterious affair. Someone is simply chosen in spring and disappears at Year’s End, never to be heard from again. On the eighth year of this rite, Stiles and Lydia turn eighteen, which automatically makes them candidates for the sacrificial pool. The name that survives Peter’s holy fire will change the course of both their lives. *** I have watched you grow. I have seen you stumble and rise. I have been charmed by your humor, your inquisitive nature, the radiance of your soul. You are not just a shade to me. You are joy. Stubbornness and defiance and unwavering love spun you into being. And I see all of these things brimming inside you. Do not doubt that I love you.
